description:
Ruby Client for Cloud Spanner API (Alpha)

Cloud Spanner API: Cloud Spanner is a managed, mission-critical, globally consistent and scalable relational database service.

  • Product Documentation

Quick Start

In order to use this library, you first need to go through the following steps:

  1. Select or create a Cloud Platform project.
  2. Enable the Cloud Spanner API.
  3. Setup Authentication.

Installation

$ gem install google-cloud-spanner

Next Steps

  • Read the Cloud Spanner API Product documentation to learn more about the product and see How-to Guides.

methods.name: new
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner.new
methods.description:
Creates a new object for connecting to the Spanner service. Each call creates a new connection.

For more information on connecting to Google Cloud see the Authentication Guide.

params.name: project
params.description:
Project identifier for the Spanner service you
are connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If
file path the file must be readable.

params.name: scope
params.description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes controlling the set of resources and operations that the connection can access. See Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs.

The default scopes are:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner.data

params.name: timeout
params.description: Default timeout to use in requests. Optional.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A hash of values to override the default
behavior of the API client. Optional.
